Package bomberman.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberman.model.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the game. Handles the actions players may try to do. (e.g. moving, planting a bomb etc.)
    Author:
    Felix Bachmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clearExplosions​(Bomb b)
      Clears the explosions of a given bomb, that is setting the tiles affected by this bomb to an EmptyTile
      private void explodeBomb​(Bomb b)
      Let a bomb explode, that is setting the tiles affected by this bomb to an ExplodingTile.
      private void gameLoop​(Renderer render, java.util.List<PlayerInputListener> inputHandlers)  
      ArenaI getArena()
      Returns the arena in which the game is taking place.
      Bomb[] getBombs()
      Returns the array of bombs.
      int getGameSize()
      Returns the size of the game.

      Returns the players which are playing the game.

      Returns the size of a tile.
      int nextId()
      Allocates a new player id and returns it.
      void plantBomb​(Player plantingPlayer, Bomb plantedBomb)
      Plants a bomb in the arena.
      void start​(Renderer render, java.util.List<PlayerInputListener> inputHandlers)
      Starts the game, that is starts the game loop.
      void tickBombs()
      Ticks down the bombs and handles events indicated by the state of the bombs which are present after ticking.
      void toggleRunning()
      Toggles whether the game is running, i.e. pausing or unpausing the game.

        public int getTileSize()
        Returns the size of a tile.

        public ArenaI getArena()
        Returns the arena in which the game is taking place.
        Returns:

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns the players which are playing the game.
        Returns:
        the players

      • getBombs

        public Bomb[] getBombs()
        Returns the array of bombs. Entries may be null if not all bombs are currently planted.
        Returns:
        the bombs

      • nextId

        public int nextId()
           throws IllegalIdRequestException
        Allocates a new player id and returns it.
        Returns:
        a id
        Throws:
        IllegalIdRequestException - thrown if there are no more ids to distribute.

      • plantBomb

        public void plantBomb​(Player plantingPlayer,
                      Bomb plantedBomb)
        Plants a bomb in the arena. The caller must assure that the player is allowed to plant the bomb.
        Parameters:
        plantingPlayer - the player which is planting the bomb
        plantedBomb - the bomb which will be planted

      • tickBombs

        public void tickBombs()
        Ticks down the bombs and handles events indicated by the state of the bombs which are present after ticking.

      • clearExplosions

        public void clearExplosions​(Bomb b)
        Clears the explosions of a given bomb, that is setting the tiles affected by this bomb to an EmptyTile
        Parameters:
        b - the bomb of which the explosions should be cleared

      • explodeBomb

        private void explodeBomb​(Bomb b)
        Let a bomb explode, that is setting the tiles affected by this bomb to an ExplodingTile.
        Parameters:
        b - the bomb to explode

      • start

        public void start​(Renderer render,
                  java.util.List<PlayerInputListener> inputHandlers)
        Starts the game, that is starts the game loop.
        Parameters:
        render - the renderer in which the game should be rendered.
        inputHandlers - the input handlers

      • gameLoop

        private void gameLoop​(Renderer render,
                      java.util.List<PlayerInputListener> inputHandlers)

      • toggleRunning

        public void toggleRunning()
        Toggles whether the game is running, i.e. pausing or unpausing the game.
